title: workloads on the CPU cores
extract: A process (a running instance of a program) consists of one or more threads. A processor core is a unit capable of processing a sequence of instructions. So there is a direct relation between threads and cores. For the OS, a thread is a unit of workload which can be scheduled to execute on a single core.Jun 1, 2012
extract_html: A process (a running instance of a program) consists of one or more threads. A processor core is a unit capable of processing a sequence of instructions. So there is a direct relation between threads and cores. For the OS, a thread is a unit of workload which can be scheduled to execute on a single core.Jun 1, 2012
